Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit his 47th home run and stole his 48th base
Three other Dodgers went deep in the first inning
Tommy Edman homered for the fourth time in 24 hours
Will Smith doubled off Shawn Armstrong in the seventh and scored on Lux’s single to center
Post-Match Reflections: Gavin Lux singled in the go-ahead run with two outs in the seventh inning and the Los Angeles Dodgers rallied after blowing a 7-3 lead to beat the Chicago Cubs 10-8 on Wednesday night and avoid a series sweep.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Max Muncy celebrated after hitting a home run during the first inning
The Cubs outscored the Dodgers 16-7 in winning the first two games
Others: The Dodgers walked 10 batters, including four by starter Bobby Miller
Alex Vesia (3-4) got the win with one inning of relief
The Cubs threatened in the ninth
The Dodgers blew a lead for the second straight game
The Cubs chased Miller with six runs, including his 16th homer, and five hits in 4 1/3 innings
The right-hander’s ERA ballooned to 8.17
The Cubs had a 2-0 hole in the first inning
The Dodgers were ahead 3-1 on Tuesday and lost 6-3
The Dodgers led 7-3 only to watch the Cubs tie it in the fifth
Miller’s performance was frustrating again
The Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Tommy Edman’s performance
